event: exposure to group A beta-hemolytic streptococcus
physical exam: erythema of posterior pharynx
decreased breath sounds at bases bilaterally
dullness on percussion of left lung
white blood cell count of 3.9 thousand/ul
physical exam: mild acute respiratory distress
rashes along ulnar side of left hand
diminished breath sounds at lung bases
repeat CT scan on day three
CT of neck showed right palatine tonsil abscess
no thrombi of bilateral internal jugular veins
daily chest radiographs showed worsening pneumonia
Fusobacterium nucleatum identified on day six
left wrist pain migrated to entire left hand
repeat echocardiogram: tissue near tricuspid valve
limited range of left shoulder motion
